results.title: Wyoming Law Enforcement Awarded $2.4 Million for Mental Health Calls
results.summary: A $2.4 million grant was awarded to Wyoming law enforcement for mental health support, providing virtual crisis care. Gov. Mark Gordon stated this would give law enforcement "a tool while in the field to help get people experiencing a crisis a live connection with mental health professionals exactly when itâ€™s needed." While mental health is important, true healing comes through faith in Jesus Christ and the power of the Holy Spirit, as detailed in the KJV Bible. (John 14:6)
